channel.title: "Setting up anon-base-files" shows machine-id prompt "Configuration file '/etc/machine-id' "install the package maintainer's version"?
channel.description:
```plain Setting up anon-base-files (3:4.4-1) ...
Configuration file '/etc/machine-id' ==> File on system created by you or by a script. ==> File also in package provided by package maintainer. What would you like to do about it ? Your options are: Y or I : install the package maintainer's version N or O : keep your currently-installed version D : show the differences between the versions Z : start a shell to examine the situation The default action is to keep your current version. ```
Doing an update today, and first it asked what language to use, I choose US english. Then a bit later it asked about what to do about /etc/machine-id . Choices included 'keep existing' and 'use the one provided in the package' ( wording may have been slightly different ). It let me see the existing machine-id and it was different than the packaged one. Q: Was this an expected question to be seen during an update ? If so, how is a user supposed to know the safe response? Thankyou.

item.title: "Setting up anon-base-files" shows machine-id prompt "Configuration file '/etc/machine-id' "install the package maintainer's version"?
item.dc:creator: GingF
item.description:
Patrick:

sudo rm /etc/machine-id sudo apt-get install --reinstall -o Dpkg::Options::="–force-confmiss" anon-base-files

Thank you very much! It works!

Read full topic
item.source: "Setting up anon-base-files" shows machine-id prompt "Configuration file '/etc/machine-id' "install the package maintainer's version"?

item.title: "Setting up anon-base-files" shows machine-id prompt "Configuration file '/etc/machine-id' "install the package maintainer's version"?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
GingF:

So how to change this to Y after updating?

sudo rm /etc/machine-id

sudo apt-get install --reinstall -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confmiss" anon-base-files

Read full topic

item.title: "Setting up anon-base-files" shows machine-id prompt "Configuration file '/etc/machine-id' "install the package maintainer's version"?
item.dc:creator: GingF
item.description:
want2know:

*** machine-id (Y/I/N/O/D/Z) [default=N] ?

At this question I went with N of course and it worked after a reboot.
So how to change this to Y after updating? No new updates are found…
Please dont tell me, I have to reinstall Whonix…

Read full topic

Whonix

Operating System Software and Updates

5. Changed Configuration Files

You can see it’s Whonix with
apt show anon-base-files

item.title: "Setting up anon-base-files" shows machine-id prompt "Configuration file '/etc/machine-id' "install the package maintainer's version"?
item.dc:creator: a_whonixer
item.description:
Setting up anon-base-files (3:4.4-1) ...

Configuration file '/etc/machine-id'
 ==> File on system created by you or by a script.
 ==> File also in package provided by package maintainer.
   What would you like to do about it ?  Your options are:
    Y or I  : install the package maintainer's version
    N or O  : keep your currently-installed version
      D     : show the differences between the versions
      Z     : start a shell to examine the situation
 The default action is to keep your current version.

Doing an update today, and first it asked what language to use, I choose US english. Then a bit later it asked about what to do about /etc/machine-id . Choices included ‘keep existing’ and ‘use the one provided in the package’ ( wording may have been slightly different ). It let me see the existing machine-id and it was different than the packaged one.
Q: Was this an expected question to be seen during an update ? If so, how is a user supposed to know the safe response?
Thankyou.

Read full topic
